parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.50

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Disable collision between vehicles. This command doesn't disable collision between PhysX objects.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>important</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Command has to be executed where objects are [[local]], and as long as they don't change locality, the effect of this command will be global.<br>
If the two objects are not local to the same computer, then it has to be executed on both computers to achieve the desired effect.<br>
If one or both objects change locality, the command needs to be executed again on the new [[owner]]'s machine(s) to maintain the effect.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object [[disableCollisionWith]] object

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[_veh1, _veh2] [[remoteExecCall]] ["disableCollisionWith", 0, _veh1];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[enableCollisionWith]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 4, 2015 - 12:03 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Ranwer|Ranwer]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
[[disableCollisionWith]] is basically a script that when you apply it to an object, and your unit can go through it like a ghost. However, if you wish the object to be solid again, you may wish to use [[enableCollisionWith]].
<br>
An example for this is: 
<code><template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>name of unit in editor such as player1</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>name of object in editor such as barrel1</value></part></template>
barrel1 [[disableCollisionWith]] player1;

<template lineStart="1"><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>to make the barrel solid again, do this as vice versa if you know what you are doing!</value></part></template>
barrel1 enableCollisionWith player1;</code>
On a side note: this can come in handy a lot if you want a unit to sit on the back of a car or on top of a container
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 29, 2018 - 06:58 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:bloodwyn1756|bloodwyn1756]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This command does not disable the roadway LOD.
</dd>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl></root>
